alert.note: Alert for Oneida; Power (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 13 at 2:29PM MDT until August 13 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pocatello has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Oneida County in southeastern Idaho... Southeastern Power County in southeastern Idaho... * Until 300 PM MDT. * At 228 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles south of Fort Hall Bannock Peak, or 25 miles northwest of Malad, moving southeast at 10 MPH. HAZARD...60 MPH wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Arbon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging winds, continuous cloud to ground lightning, and very torrential rain is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. If you observe flooding, debris flows, hail, or wind damage, please report your observations to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, as soon as it is safe to do so.
